subject: Re: [junit] Re: Non-optimal ordering of parameters
msgSnippet: ... Interesting take! It makes sense that what was I expecting would be the first thing you d want to see, especially given a literal value.
messageBody:
Paul Zabelin wrote:
> JUnit assertions and parameter order is working very well for me.
> Browsing through the tests, I get faster when expected outcome is
> clearly more visible, than how it was achieved.
> Message string is more important, that assert itself, as it is
> written in human language, which one browse faster than Java code.
>
Interesting take!

It makes sense that "what was I expecting" would be the first
thing you'd want to see, especially given a literal value.
